In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function `wrap_string` in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, ' ')
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
        elseif !isempty(result)
            result *= " "
        end
        result *= word
    end
    return result
end
```

Here is an example usage:

```julia
s = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped because it exceeds the maximum width of 10 characters."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

The output will look like this:

```
This is a 
very long 
string that 
needs to be 
wrapped because 
it exceeds the 
maximum width 
of 10 characters.
```
